dtliExcerpt: As both the heart and the court jester for the show, Corden is superb, a perfectly calibrated level of hysterical, sincere and crisp. One blistering monologue sees him ranting, in the voice of three separate characters, for several minutes straight without missing a beat; it was not celebrity compelling the extended applause when he finally collapsed, spent and spittle-covered, into a chair.

keyPhrases.quote: Corden is superb, a perfectly calibrated level of hysterical, sincere and crisp.
It was not celebrity compelling the extended applause when he finally collapsed, spent and spittle-covered, into a chair.

llmScore.reasoning: The excerpt focuses exclusively on praising Corden's performance as 'superb' with vivid description of audience response, but provides no evaluation of the show itself.
